Ingredients.6: 4 (12.4 ounce) packages refrigerated cinnamon roll dough with icing (such as Pillsbury® Grands!®)

Ingredients.8: 0.25 cups unsalted butter, at room temperature, divided

Ingredients.10: 0.25 cup lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage (such as 7-Up®)

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt®) with butter-flavored cooking spray.

Directions.2: Mix white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a bowl.

Directions.3: Open the refrigerated cinnamon rolls. Divide rolls by package, then cut into quarters with a pizza/dough cutter.

Directions.4: Place each package of cut cinnamon roll pieces in the sugar mixture and toss until covered, keeping them separated. Do not discard excess sugar mixture.

Directions.5: Layer each separate portion of sugar-coated cinnamon roll pieces in the bottom of the prepared pan, sprinkling with pecans as you go, ending with pecans on top.

Directions.6: Combine excess sugar mixture with 3/4 cup of butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; bring to a boil. Pour butter mixture over the cinnamon roll pieces.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven until the top is crispy, about 40 minutes. Remove and allow to cool for 10 minutes.

Directions.8: While cooling, mix confectioners' sugar, lemon-lime beverage, oats, and remaining 1/2 cup of room temperature butter together for icing.

Directions.9: Remove the bread from the Bundt® pan, then drizzle the icing over the bread to taste.
